# Introduction


### Download a CSV Example
```{python}
#| echo: true
#| code-fold: true
from numpy import mean, diff, array
from timeit import default_timer
import requests

file_location = "./data/10mb.csv"

# SHAPE OF CSV (9453, 9)
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/frictionlessdata/datasets/main/files/csv/10mb.csv"
with open(file_location, "wb") as f:
    f.write(requests.get(url).content)
```


# Reading in CSVs


:::: {.columns style="font-size: 100%;"}

::: {.column width="50%;"}

```{python}
#| code-summary: "Pandas"
#| echo: true
#| code-fold: true
NUMBER_SIMULATIONS = int(1e2)
import pandas as pd

all_panda_read_times = []
start = default_timer()
for j in range(NUMBER_SIMULATIONS):
    df_pandas = pd.read_csv(file_location)
    all_panda_read_times.append(default_timer())

all_panda_read_times = array(
    [all_panda_read_times[1] - start]
    + list(diff(all_panda_read_times))
)
panda_mean_run_time = mean(all_panda_read_times)
print(
    f"panda mean run-time is {panda_mean_run_time:.4f} secs"
)


```

:::


::: {.column width="50%;"}

```{python}
#| code-summary: "Pandas"
#| echo: true
#| code-fold: true
NUMBER_SIMULATIONS = int(1e2)
import polars as pl

all_polar_read_times = []
start = default_timer()
for j in range(NUMBER_SIMULATIONS):
    df_polars =pl.read_csv(file_location)
    all_polar_read_times.append(default_timer())

all_polar_read_times = array(
    [all_polar_read_times[1] - start]
    + list(diff(all_polar_read_times))
)
polar_mean_run_time = mean(all_polar_read_times)
print(
    f"polar mean run-time is {polar_mean_run_time:.4f} secs"
)


```
